steps.title: Choose whether or not that you want to use the Tips feature.
steps.content: Choose whether or not that you want to use the Tips feature.

steps.title: Open a new text document.
steps.content: Open a new text document. If on the desktop, click Start >> All Programs >> OpenOffice >> OpenOffice Writer. If you are in OpenOffice Writer, click File > New > Text Document. In either case, A text document appears on your screen. (The name of the text document appears at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Look at the menu bar.
steps.content: Look at the menu bar. The next line down that starts with the word File is called the Menu Bar. (Clicking on a word in the Menu Bar shows a list of things that you can choose to do in Writer. This list is called a Menu.) The second line down is the Standard Toolbar. (Clicking on a small picture will make available a specific function that can be done in Writer.) The third line down is the Formatting Toolbar. (Additional specific functions that can be done in Writer are on this line.) The fourth line down is the Ruler which appears on the top and the left side of the page. (Click “View”. If there is a check mark by Ruler, a ruler will appear at the top and the left side of your page on the screen.) The Horizontal Ruler is below. Note the numbers on the ruler. The numbers on the Ruler on the left side of the page indicate where the text is located on the page from the top of the page. The numbers at the top of the page indicate the location of the text from the left or right sides of the page.) Right-click on the Ruler to see the choices for the settings which are Millimeter, Centimeter, Inch, Point, and Pica. The Horizontal Scroll bar (by clicking and holding the pointer, you can navigate a document left and right) is located at the bottom of the page above the Status Bar which is the line at the bottom of the screen that starts with Page 1/1. (This line gives you information about the document you are presently using.) The Vertical Scroll Bar (by clicking and holding the pointer, you can navigate up and down) is located on the right side of your screen.

steps.title: Decide on the paper size that you need.
steps.content: Decide on the paper size that you need.

steps.title: Click Format >> Page >> Page tab.
steps.content: Click Format >> Page >> Page tab. The “Page Style: Default” window appears For this how-to, use a paper size of 8 ½ by 11 inches (27.9 cm) which is a common size in the USA.

steps.title: Under “Paper format”, in the “Format” pull-down menu, select Letter if it is not already selected.
steps.content: Under “Paper format”, in the “Format” pull-down menu, select Letter if it is not already selected. To use other paper sizes, open the “Format” pull-down menu and select a size of your choice. Words, numbers, and graphics can be placed anywhere on a sheet of paper except for a small border at the four outer edges of the paper. The word margin is used to describe the boundary lines where the borders end and the words begin. All future added words, numbers, and graphics will stay within the lines that indicate the margins. The margin lines appear on the screen and will not appear on the printed page.

steps.title: Adjust indents with the three small triangles on the horizontal ruler or use the “Paragraph” window > “Indents & Spacing” tab by double-clicking anywhere on the horizontal ruler.
steps.content: Adjust indents with the three small triangles on the horizontal ruler or use the “Paragraph” window > “Indents & Spacing” tab by double-clicking anywhere on the horizontal ruler.

steps.title: Change the left or the right paragraph indent
steps.content: Change the left or the right paragraph indent by highlighting the paragraph(s) that you want to change the indent, drag the bottom left or the bottom right triangle on the horizontal ruler to a new location.

steps.title: Change the first line indent of a selected paragraph, drag the top left triangle on the Horizontal Ruler to a new location.
steps.content: Change the first line indent of a selected paragraph, drag the top left triangle on the Horizontal Ruler to a new location.

steps.title: Adjust the indents by double-clicking anywhere on the Horizontal Ruler and adjust the indents in the Paragraph dialog.
steps.content: Adjust the indents by double-clicking anywhere on the Horizontal Ruler and adjust the indents in the Paragraph dialog. (The “Paragraph” window appears.)

steps.title: Find the Gallery icon
steps.content: Find the Gallery icon , . Click on the Gallery icon. (The Gallery window appears on the screen. The background changes color when the icon is in use. Some users may see a white background and some may see a blue background.)

steps.title: Click on the Gallery icon again to close the window.
steps.content: Click on the Gallery icon again to close the window. (There is no background color on the “Gallery” icon.)

steps.title: Right-click anywhere on the printed or white page area.
steps.content: Right-click anywhere on the printed or white page area. (Right-click means to press and release the button on the right side of the mouse with your middle finger. Click only one time unless instructed to double-click. A menu appears on the page. To close the window, click anywhere on the page other than on the menu.)

steps.title: On the Menu Bar, click on Insert.
steps.content: On the Menu Bar, click on Insert. (The “Insert” menu appears. This is a list of the various things you can choose to do in Writer.)

steps.title: On the Menu Bar, click on the word File.
steps.content: On the Menu Bar, click on the word File. (A menu opens that has a list of words.)

steps.title: Click on the words, Save As.
steps.content: Click on the words, Save As. (The “Save As” window appears.)

steps.title: Click My Documents > File name:
steps.content: Click My Documents > File name: (If the words, "My Documents", are not already in the "Save in:" dialog box, click the at the right end of the “Save in:' dialog box. A menu will appear; find “My Documents'” on this menu and click it. "My Documents" appears in the "Save in:" dialog box. If the cursor is not flashing in the “File name:” dialog box at the bottom of the “Save As:” window, move the I-beam pointer into the box and click. The cursor is flashing in the “File name:” dialog box.)

steps.title: In the File name:
steps.content: In the File name: dialog box, type the words "My Lesson". In the Save as type: pull-down menu box, click OpenDocument Text (.odt) if it is not already selected. Click on the Save button located to the right of the File name: dialog box. (The “My Lesson” file has been saved on your computer in the folder, "My Documents", and can be opened later. The top line on the screen has changed to . This indicates the file “My Lesson” is still open on your computer.)

steps.title: Click the word, File, again.
steps.content: Click the word, File, again. Click the word, Close. (The “My Lesson” file is closed and is not seen on the screen.)

steps.title: Click File > Open.
steps.content: Click File > Open. (The “Open” window appears. If "My Documents" is not already in the Look in: dialog box at the top of the "Open" window, in the list of directories below the Look in: box, click "My Documents". The words, "My Documents", appear in the "Look in:" dialog box.)

steps.title: Click on My Lesson in the list below the Look in:
steps.content: Click on My Lesson in the list below the Look in: dialog box. (The words, “My Lesson”, appear in the “File name:” dialog box.)

steps.title: Click the Open button
steps.content: Click the Open button which is to the right of the File name: dialog box. (The top line on the screen changes to and the first page of the file, “My Lesson”, appears on the screen below the ruler.)

steps.title: Undo entries(delete them)in the reverse order in which the entries were made.
steps.content: Undo entries(delete them)in the reverse order in which the entries were made. Word(s), graphic(s), and paragraph(s) can be deleted and "Undo" can be used to put them back in your document. Type the three paragraphs below. This is the first paragraph. This is the second paragraph. This is the third paragraph.

steps.title: Place the pointer on the page and click where the symbol is to appear.
steps.content: Place the pointer on the page and click where the symbol is to appear.

steps.title: Click Insert > Special Character
steps.content: Click Insert > Special Character . (The "Special Characters" window appears. You will see two dialog boxes. The one on the left is the "Font" menu and the one on the right is the “Subset” menu.)

steps.title: In the Subset menu, click on the until you see Miscellaneous Symbols.
steps.content: In the Subset menu, click on the until you see Miscellaneous Symbols. Click Miscellaneous Symbols .

steps.title: Scroll until you see the "☺" symbol.
steps.content: Scroll until you see the "☺" symbol. Click on the "☺" .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK. The ☺symbol appears on the page.

steps.title: On the Menu Bar, click on the word Help.
steps.content: On the Menu Bar, click on the word Help. (A menu appears)

steps.title: Click on the words, What's this?
steps.content: Click on the words, What's this? . (The mouse pointer becomes ).

steps.title: On the Standard Toolbar, move the pointer onto a picture (icon).
steps.content: On the Standard Toolbar, move the pointer onto a picture (icon). (A brief description of what the picture does appears on the screen)

steps.title: On the Standard Toolbar and the Formatting Toolbar, move the pointer onto the icons to see what is there.
steps.content: On the Standard Toolbar and the Formatting Toolbar, move the pointer onto the icons to see what is there.

steps.title: To get rid of the question mark, click anywhere on the screen below the Standard Toolbar and the Formatting Toolbar.
steps.content: To get rid of the question mark, click anywhere on the screen below the Standard Toolbar and the Formatting Toolbar.
